label: Ghostly white horse - appears when the locals are in danger
Schimmelreiter
column5: The 'Rider on the white horse' appears when a storm threatens. Also appears on local flags.

longitude: 0.0533086 Tatterfoal https://lincolnshirefolktalesproject.com/2024/04/16/tatterfoal Tatterfoal is a mischievous ghost-horse from Lincolnshire folklore
label: reported in older sources as haunting places like Frieston and Barton-upon-Humber. In one version collected by folklorist Mabel Peacock
link: the eerie creature turns out not to be supernatural at all but just a prankster in disguise
column5: and the name later inspired a local Morris dancing group. #ghost-horse#attrib

longitude: 0.3222195 Gibraltar Point Fog Horse https://lincolnshirefolktalesproject.com/2024/05/20/gibraltar-point-fog-horse A farmer taking a foggy shortcut along the beach at Gibraltar Point drowned in the rising tide
label: and ever since the frantic sound of ghostly hooves is said to thunder across the sands when the mist rolls in. The tale survives mainly as a reported haunting rather than a full narrative
link: with versions noting that it may date back as far as the 1700s. #ghost-horse#attrib
